intro: Wormia artocarpifolia, commonly known as the mango worm plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that contain a single seed. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and horticultural interest.
